text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to advise on the potential availability of the partial defence of Loss of Control (s. 54 Coroners and Justice Act 2009) as a fallback option resulting in manslaughter should self-defence fail. The candidate answer focuses exclusively and comprehensively on the primary defence of self-defence, detailing the statutory and common law tests, the impact of mistaken belief, and relevant case law. However, it makes absolutely no mention of the partial defence of Loss of Control (or the previous defence of provocation) as a fallback option, which is the specific requirement of this criterion.", "criterion_id": "60b81a16-8e7e-40bf-8f49-16a0e95fc1f9"}
